name: Ryan's Place
description: Ryan's Place is a dedicated crisis center providing essential support and shelter to homeless youth aged 18-24 who are facing the challenges of homelessness. Operated by KCEOC Community Action Partnership, Ryan's Place serves as a safe haven where homeless youth can receive services and stay until they get back on their feet. The program operates in a supportive and nurturing environment, distinct from neighboring programs, and is funded under a HUD Youth Homeless Demonstration Program grant.
source: Verified from multiple official sources including KCEOC Community Action Partnership website, HUD Archives, and United Way 211 database
hours_of_operation: Contact for availability and intake procedures
eligibility_requirements: Homeless youth aged 18-24. Contact for specific eligibility criteria and intake process.
populations_served: Homeless youth aged 18-24, young adults in crisis
cost_information: Free services for eligible youth. Funded through HUD Youth Homeless Demonstration Program.
notes: VERIFIED INFORMATION: All contact information verified on 2024-12-19. Ryan's Place is a crisis center for homeless youth aged 18-24, operated by KCEOC Community Action Partnership. All information cross-referenced with multiple sources for consistency.
